section.title: Working with Parent Zone
section.para:
As we mentioned in , the format of the information you upload to your parent zone is dictated by your parent zone administrator, and the three main formats are:
DS Record Format DNSKEY Format Trusted Key Format
Next, we will take a look at how to get each of the three formats from your existing data.

section.title: DS Record Format
section.para: Below is an example of generating DS record formats from the KSK we created earlier (Kexample.com.+008+28267.key) using two different secure hashing algorithms (SHA-1 and SHA-256, respectively): # cd /etc/bind/keys # dnssec-dsfromkey -a SHA-1 Kexample.com.+008+28267.key example.com. IN DS 28267 8 1 66D47CE4B4F551BE5EDA43AC5F3109E8C98E2FAE # dnssec-dsfromkey -a SHA-256 ksk.key example.com. IN DS 28267 8 2 71D9335416B7132519190A95685E18CBF478DCF4CA98867062777938F8FEAB89
